pr_title: [KEYCLOAK-14046] Include groups in user creation via Admin Console

timeline.message: Flatten nested groups in user creation groups searchbox

timeline.bodyText:
I'm no UX expert but I'm not sure this is ok from the UX PoV. You have a search field and then you have a table below with selected values. Both have a remove button, one as a cross symbol, the other as a bigger button with text:

This feels to me a bit confusing and even inconsistent with other places.
Couldn't we use the same approach as with e.g. Required Actions?
timeline.author: vmuzikar
timeline.diffHunk:
@@ -97,6 +97,42 @@ {{:: 'email-verified.tooltip' | translate}} +
+ +
+ + + +
+
+
+
+

replies.bodyText:
I've copy-pasted a component used in Permissions UI:

IMO, a tabular view better highlights groups hierarchy, compared to a "tags input".
replies.author: clementcur

replies.bodyText: Yes, you're correct. But there it works a bit differently. Once you've clicked a policy in the search bar, it appears in the table below and the search bar is cleared. There are no duplicit "remove" buttons.
replies.author: vmuzikar

replies.bodyText:
@vmuzikar The x means "clear the field".  That's different from remove and it's the way PatternFly does it.
The Required Actions solution uses chip groups, which are not appropriate here because chip groups get very hard to manage when you have more than a few items.  See the Login Events Settings for a really horrific example of this.
replies.author: ssilvert

replies.bodyText: The group selector is still not quite working right.  For instance, here there is no "s" in /group1, but it shows that group anyway.  Looks like it's because it has a subgroup with an "s" in it.
replies.author: ssilvert
vmuzikar

replies.bodyText:
The group selector is still not quite working right. For instance, here there is no "s" in /group1, but it shows that group anyway. Looks like it's because it has a subgroup with an "s" in it.

This is what our REST API returns so I'd say it is out of scope of this PR. It's probably implemented like that because of the "tree" UI the Groups section uses. When you search for a group, you need to see all its parents to be able to properly display the tree.
Maybe we could do some filtering at the UI side but I'm not sure that's the correct approach.
replies.author: vmuzikar

replies.bodyText: I've flatten and filtered out searched groups in latest commit. Also, I made sure the input is cleared after selection, so there's no confusion.
replies.author: clementcur

timeline.bodyText: The search field is not aligned correctly with the table header on Chrome and Safari. Please see the screenshot above.
timeline.author: vmuzikar
timeline.diffHunk:
@@ -97,6 +97,42 @@ {{:: 'email-verified.tooltip' | translate}} +
+ +
+ + + +
+
+
+

replies.bodyText:
It's correctly aligned on my side and seems OK on ssilvert's screenshot too. Maybe check if you're not zoomed in.
The html code is strictly copy-pasted from the Permissions UI.
replies.author: clementcur

replies.bodyText: I'm not zoomed in. :) It's ok in Firefox, misaligned in Chrome and Safari.
replies.author: vmuzikar

replies.bodyText: I've fixed the alignment in the latest commit.
replies.author: clementcur

timeline.bodyText:
It is possible to add a user to both child and parent group at the same time. It should be possible to add them only to one of the roles with the parent roles added transiently.
This is issue, however, concerns the underlaying REST API as well so maybe it is out of scope of this PR? @stianst?
timeline.author: vmuzikar

replies.bodyText: This UI is driven by the REST Admin API. If we want a special behavior, we'll need to change that in the API itself. IMO, this is a different topic.
replies.author: clementcur

replies.bodyText: Since every node of the groups tree is now listed in search results, it's possible to add both parent and child groups.
replies.author: clementcur

timeline.bodyText: Strictly speaking, a user test shouldn't also test creating of groups. A better approach would be to just use the REST API to create the group. But since you already implemented that, let's leave it as is. :)
timeline.author: vmuzikar

timeline.bodyText: Even though this is out of scope of this PR, thanks for adding it. It's a shame we didn't have UI tests for groups. :(
timeline.author: vmuzikar

timeline.bodyText: I'm getting some compilation errors here. The tests need to be passing with Java 8 (which is used by our CI).
timeline.author: vmuzikar

timeline.bodyText: This test seem to be failing. Needs to be passing with FF and Chrome.
timeline.author: vmuzikar

timeline.bodyText: This test seem to be failing. Needs to be passing with FF and Chrome.
timeline.author: vmuzikar

timeline.bodyText: I don't think you need to pass in "subGroups".  I don't think that value can ever change.
timeline.author: ssilvert

timeline.message:
[KEYCLOAK-14046] Include groups in user creation via Admin Console

Since the POST /users API now supports providing groups membership, here is the UI
part!

- Added a field in the user creation UI to specify groups the newly created user
will be joining
- Added associated messages in english language
Flatten nested groups in user creation groups searchbox
